a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes N :: real and hash :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> N. hash N = 0.5 * N + 1"
shows  "hash (hash (hash 50)) = 8"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Define $\#N$ by the formula $\#N = .5(N) + 1$. Calculate $\#(\#(\#50))$. The final Answer is 8
 ### Proof
 We have  \begin{align} \#(\#(\#50))&=\#(\#(.5(50)+1))=\#(\#(26))\\ &=\#(.5(26)+1)=\#(14)=(.5(14)+1)=\boxed{8}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes N :: real and hash :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> N. hash N = 0.5 * N + 1"
shows  "hash (hash (hash 50)) = 8"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: A hash function is defined for any real number $N$ as $hash(N) = 0.5N + 1$. What is the value of $hash(hash(hash(50)))$? The final answer is $8$.
